review: I've owned a Roku and 3 different gaming consoles, which offer similar streaming capabilities. Google Chromecast is by far the easiest to use, and the least expensive option.It's almost perfect, but there's a few things that need to be improved1) Video can sometimes appear a little grainy when compared to the source. It's not terrible, but I noticed it the other day when I was streaming the NCAA tournament from my laptop to the Chromecast.2) More app/browser integrations. Chromecast works perfectly in the Google ecosystem, but if you want to stream something from iTunes or Amazon you're out of luck.I'm hoping the product continues to improve.

review: I have had this for over a year and I love it. I use it to stream movies from anything I want including game apps to my TV. I do this by a app called chrome cast the only thing is it only works with some android phones I use a galaxy s5 active and it works wonderful also used a nexus 4 with it. Any of Google phones such as the nexus line you should be able to do this with. I am not sure what other phones you can do this with it is only 35 dollars so give it a shot I say and if don't work send it back. Yes you need a hdmi port on your TV for this to work as well as a USB port or a plugin close by where you can plug in the micro USB cable to power this at. As well if you don't have a USB port on the TV you will need a convertor that converts USB to 2 prog plug.
